input.description:
An error code. If code exists, then, an XML is returned. For example: 100 Unknown error
Uknown error
Please contact BAO administrator If code does not exist, it will return an error text indicating error with the given code does not exist. For example: Error definition with code: '10' not found!

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="boolean(//*[code/text() = '${error code}'])"> <xsl:copy-of select="//*[code/text() = '${error code}']" /> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <result> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">Error definition with code: '${error code}' not found!</xsl:text> </result> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>
